# Pull Request

## Summary

Provide a brief description of the changes in this pull request.

## Problem

Describe the problem this PR is solving. Link to any related issues (e.g. `Fixes #123`).

## Solution

Explain how you solved the problem. Highlight any important design decisions or trade-offs.

## Testing

Describe how you tested these changes:

- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests  
- [ ] Manual testing
- [ ] E2E tests

Include commands run and relevant output if helpful.

### Test Environment
- **Frontend**: tutera-frontend (version/branch)
- **Backend**: tutera-backend (version/branch)
- **Browser**: (e.g. Chrome 130, Safari 18)
- **Node.js**: (e.g. 18.19.0)

## Screenshots (if applicable)

Add screenshots or recordings to illustrate UI changes.

## Code Review Checklist

### General Requirements
- [ ] I have read and followed the [contributing guidelines](../CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [ ] I have added or updated tests as appropriate
- [ ] I have updated documentation where necessary
- [ ] I have verified that all linters and tests pass locally
- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code

### Frontend Changes (if applicable)
- [ ] Components are properly typed with TypeScript
- [ ] Responsive design has been considered
- [ ] Accessibility best practices are followed
- [ ] Performance implications have been considered
- [ ] State management is implemented correctly

### Backend Changes (if applicable)
- [ ] API endpoints are properly documented
- [ ] Database schema changes are handled with migrations
- [ ] Security implications have been considered
- [ ] Error handling is comprehensive
- [ ] Logging is appropriate for debugging

### Testing Requirements
- [ ] Unit tests cover new functionality
- [ ] Integration tests verify component interactions
- [ ] Manual testing confirms expected behavior
- [ ] No existing functionality is broken

## Additional Notes

Add any additional context, deployment considerations, or notes for reviewers.

---

## Labels

Suggested labels for this PR:
- `bug` - Bug fixes
- `enhancement` - New features or improvements
- `documentation` - Documentation changes
- `breaking-change` - Changes that break existing functionality
- `dependencies` - Dependency updates
- `performance` - Performance improvements
- `security` - Security-related changes

---

**Thank you for contributing to Tutera!**
